title: Paranoid about a plastic straw [Florida] : r/legaladvice - Reddit
body: I lost a small 2-inch plastic straw somewhere in my car. I cleaned and vacuumed the inside of my car but couldn't find it, it's under the seats…
readable_content:
- KappaSigma1 (2023-12-08): Paranoid about a plastic straw [Florida]
  
I lost a small 2-inch plastic straw somewhere in my car. I cleaned and vacuumed the inside of my car but couldn't find it, it's under the seats somewhere. On the slight chance that a police officer searches my vehicle and finds it, would a microscopic amount of cocaine residue be enough to get someone in trouble?

- A_Criminal_Lawyer (2023-12-08): In Florida, possession of cocaine, in any amount, is a felony. The straw itself can also be considered paraphernalia which is a misdemeanor. Typical clients with those charges don't walk away without at least a few months of jail time. I suggest quitting the habit since it eventually catches up to you in the form of handcuffs and a jail cell. If you have an addiction, please seek rehab.

- litmustest1 (2023-12-08): Yes

- hortonhoo (2023-12-08): Find that straw and get rid of it. If discovered by an officer, you could definitely face charges for possession of drug paraphernalia.

- mbz321 (2023-12-08): LOL
